meanings.definition: To cause to become angry or irritated.
meanings.sent1: When my brother hides my toys, it really madders me.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site madders the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy madders the cat by stealing its food.
meanings.sent4: The constant delays in the project madders the team's progress.
meanings.sent5: Her constant interruptions during the meeting really madders everyone's focus.
